name: Selata | Salad
description: Salad is served as a side dish with most traditional dishes.

ingredients.ingredient: serrano pepper, cut into small pieces

directions.step: Make the dressing ahead by combining salt, pepper, olive oil and lime into a medium salad bowl. I recommend adding a little bit more salt than you usually use to make the salad tasty. Then, whisk the mix well.
Add the onion, tomatoes, lettuce on a medium bowl. When you are ready to serve the salad, add the dressing onto th bowl mix and toss it. Otherwise, refrigerate until serving.
Trim the collard greens to discard tough stem. If you want the leaf part only, you can further remove all the stem using hands.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add collards and cook until tender, for about 15 minutes. Drain well in a colander.
Squeeze the boiled collard greens to drain the remaining water and chop.
In a medium pan over medium-low heat, add onion and oil and cook, stirring often, until the onion is translucent. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the collard greens on the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes.
Add the jalapeno pepper, salt, pepper and butter; Cook for an additional 3 minutes and Serve.

name: Awaze | Hot Sauce
description: Awaze is very easy to make and is served as spicy sauce with most main courses.

directions.step: In a small bowl, combine berbere, salt and pepper.
Add the olive oil, wine or tej and water into the bowl. Mix thoroughly until all the berbere powder is blended.
Serve it as a sauce with foods like Tibs and raw beef or store in covered container. Refrigerate the remaining for future use.

name: Ayib | Cottage Cheese
description: Ayib is served with spicy dishes like Kitfo (Beef tartar) and Doro (Chicken) wot to tone down the food spiciness.

directions.step: In a large pot over medium heat, add the milk and vinegar. Stir the ingredients.
Bring the milk to a boil for 50 minutes until curds form. Remove from heat.
Spoon the curdled milk into the sieve. Place over a bowl, cover, refrigerate. Let it drain until most of the water comes out for at least 2 hours before serving.
Discard the liquid. Place the cheese in a bowl and season with salt.
Heat oil in a medium pan over a medium temperature.
Place the beef on the pan and cook for 5 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Then, add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for another 10 minutes.
Add the tomato, wine, pepper and salt to the mix and cook for another 5 minutes.
Put the jalapeno pepper and the rosemary and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve with injera
Using a medium saut√© pan over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion; cook until tender.
Add tomato and garlic. Cook until tomatoes are shriveled while stirring occasionally.
Add water and shiro. Stir well to combine shiro with mix. Cook for 10 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Lower the heat to low. Add the last three items and cook for another 10 minutes.

name: Kitfo | Spicy Beef Tartar
description: This classic dish is a spicy beef that is traditionally served raw but can be served cooked. It is IMPORTANT to start preparing it few minutes before serving. Kitfo is typically served with collard greens (Gomen) and Ethiopian cheese (Ayib) as well as some form of bread, either a traditional flatbread (injera) or a bread made from the banana-like ensete plant.

directions.step: On a medium pan, over a lower heat melt the butter. Add the mitmita, cardamom, salt then remove from heat.
Mix spices with butter. Add beef on the pan.

Using a mixing utensil or your hand, combine the ground meat with the spicy butter; It is important to thoroughly mix so every beef bite contains all the spice and butter. If preferred, cook the marinated meat for few more minutes until desired.
Place it on a lightly warm serving dish and serve it immediately.
Heat oil in a medium-low non-stick pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender.
Add tomato, berbere and garlic. Cook for 10 minutes by adding a cup of water in small portions while stirring occasionally.
Combine the lentil with the mix. Cook for 5 minutes. Then, add 4 cups of water and in small portions and stir occasionally for 15 minutes.
Lower the heat to low. Add the last three items and cook for another 5 minutes.
Store leftover in the freezer if it will be used later than the following day.
Combine oil and onion on a medium pan and start cooking with medium-low heat until onion becomes tender
Add the tomato to the pan and cook until it gets mushy.
Put eggs, pepper and salt to the pan and cook for 5 minutes.
Add the jalape√±o pepper and cook for about 2 minutes.
Wash bulgur until water becomes relatively clear.
Combine the bulgur, salt and water in a medium sauce pan. Bring to boil.
Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until tender. Drain, if necessary.
Melt the butter in a medium pan over low heat. Mix mitmita and black pepper with butter.
Add the bulger to the pan and combine thoroughly with the butter mix.

In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. Stir in water and 1 tbsp oil. Knead 10-12 times, adding a little flour or water if needed to achieve a smooth dough. Divide dough into four portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a circle.
In a large nonstick skillet coated with 1 tbsp of oil, cook dough over low heat on each side or until lightly browned. When the temperature of the bread cools, slice the bread into one inch.
Melt the butter in a pan over low heat. Combine the berbere, salt and honey with butter.
Add the sliced bread onto the pan and mix well. You can also use your hands to mash the bread so that the oil mix blend into the bread.

name: Timatim Selata | Tomato Salad
description: Tomato Salad is served as a side dish with most dishes.

ingredients.ingredient: serrano pepper, cut into small pieces

directions.step: In a medium salad bowl, add the salt, black pepper, olive oil and lime and whisk to combine.
Add diced tomato, onion and serrano pepper onto the bowl. Toss gently to combine.
Cover and refrigerate until serving.
In a medium pan, heat oil over medium heat. Then, add onion and cook until onion turns tender.
Add the garlic, tomato, berbere and 1/3 cup water. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes.
Then, add the dried meat and 2/3 cup of water and let it cook for 10 minutes. Stir the mix in between.
Sprinkle the salt and pepper, add 2 1/2 cup of water and cook for 5 minutes.
Cut injera in large pieces. Add the injera to the pan and combine with sauce by stirring slowly for few times.
Serve it with injera or bread.
Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender.
Add tomato and garlic. Cook until tomatoes are shriveled, then add meat and cook for 5 minutes stirring occasionally.
Add water and Shiro. Combine well with mix and cook for 10 minutes.
Lower the heat to medium-low. Add the jalape√±o pepper, butter and salt; and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Mix the besso, mitmita, salt and sugar in a medium bowl.
Add the warm water and oil/butter into the bowl and mix well.
Get a handful of besso mix from the bowl, make a fist and squeeze it while turning. The step will make it easier to grab the besso and eat it.
Serve it with coffee or tea.

name: Senig Kariya | Stuffed Serrano Pepper
description: Senig is mostly served with vegetarian and vegan courses as a side dish.

directions.step: Take out the watery part from the chopped tomato and place it in a refrigerator for another use.
In a small bowl, add onion, tomato, black pepper, salt and oil and toss it.
Slice the peppers and remove the seeds. Keep the stem of the peppers for holding the pepper later.
Spoon an equal amount of the mixture and insert it into each hollowed pepper.
Serve as a side with vegetarian dishes.
In a medium pan, heat oil over medium heat. Then, add onion and cook until onion turns tender.
Add the garlic, tomato, berbere and 1/3 cup water. Cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes.
Then, add the beef and cook for another 5 minutes.
Sprinkle the salt and pepper and combine the water with the beef mix. Cook for additional 5 minutes.
Slice injera in large pieces. Add the injera to the pan and combine with sauce by stirring slowly for few times.
Serve it with injera or bread.

ingredients.ingredient: carrots, peeled and cut into sticks

directions.step: In a large pan, heat oil over medium-low heat. Add the sliced carrot and cook until tender.
Add onion and garlic in the pan and saute until tender while stirring occasionally.
Place the cabbage on the pan with other vegetables and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes. Add a little bit of water, if necessary.
Add the serrano pepper, salt and pepper and cook for an additional 5 minutes. It is then ready to serve.

name: Genfo
description: Genfo is a thick porridge which is usually made of barley flour.

directions.step: Place the flour onto a sieve; and strain and remove the coarse part of the flour that is on the sieve (Optional step).
Add the water, milk and salt on a medium pot. Boil over a medium heat.
Reduce half a cup of the liquid from the pot and place by the side.
Combine the flour with the liquid mix by mashing and stirring. Let the mix cook for 3 minutes.
Add a little bit of liquid, cook for 3 minutes and mash the mix; . Repeat this process 3 times.
Melt the butter on a small bowl. Brush a medium bowl with a small amount of butter. Add the Genfo mix on the bowl and roll it on a circular way until Genfo becomes ball shaped.
Create a hole in the center (like in the picture). Fill butter and berbere onto the hole. Serve it right away.

name: Dinch Be'siga | Beef and Potatoe Wot

directions.step: In a medium pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add the onion to the pot and saute until tender.
Add the tomato, garlic, berbere to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes by adding a small amount of water and stirring frequently.
Then, place the meat on the pot and cook until tender. Add a small amount of water if necessary and stir the mix in between.

Add potatoes and 3 cups of water onto the pot. Cook with medium-low heat while stirring slowly and frequently. Check if potatoes are cooked enough. You can do this by trying to see if one break easily with cooking utensil.
Combine the butter, salt and pepper with meat mix. Lower the heat and cook for another 2 minutes.
Place it aside to cool. Serve it with injera.

name: Ye'Bere Siga Wot | Spicy Beef Stew
description: Sega wot is a spicy but delicious beef stew. To calm down the spicyness of the stew, you can serve it with a side of ayib/plain yogurt.

directions.step: In a medium pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add the onion to the pot and saute until tender.
Add the tomato, garlic, berbere to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes by adding a small amount of water and stirring frequently.
Then, place meat on the pot and cook until tender. Add a small amount of water if necessary and stir the mix in between.
Add 4 cups of water onto the pot. Lower heat medium-low and cook for 30 minutes while stirring frequently.
Sprinkle the ginger, salt and pepper; Add butter, lower the heat and cook for another 2 minutes.
Place it aside to cool. Serve it with injera or bread.

ingredients.ingredient: green beans, ends removed and halved

directions.step: Place a medium pan over a medium-low heat. Add oil, onion and garlic. Saute until tender.
Add turmeric, green beans and carrot to the pan. saute, stirring, them until softened.

Add the salt and water, stir until combined. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until the vegetables are very soft and most of the liquid has evaporated. Stir the vegetables occasionally and add extra water if necessary.

name: Alecha Kik | Split Pea Wot
description: This stew is very similar to Indian split pea daal.

directions.step: In large pot, cover peas with 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and cook till tender, about 30-45 minutes. Slightly, mash the peas.
Meanwhile, add oil, onion and garlic in a deep pan. Cook stirring occasionally, until translucent.
Add cooked split peas (water included), turmeric, ginger and salt into the onion mixture. Mix, cover and cook on medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add serrano pepper. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve it with injera, bread or rice.

ingredients.ingredient: serrano pepper, cut into small pieces

directions.step: Make the dressing by adding salt, pepper, olive oil and lime into a medium salad bowl. I recommend adding a little bit more salt than you usually use to make the salad tasty. Then, whisk the mix well.
Add the avocado onto the dressing and mash it slightly.
Next, add the onion, tomatoes, lettuce and pepper on the avocado mix and toss them in the bowl.
Serve or cover and refrigerate until serving.
In large pot, cover lentils with 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and cook till tender, about 25 minutes. Then, slightly mash the Lentil.
In a medium pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add the onion to the pot and saute until tender.
Add the tomato and garlic to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes by stirring frequently.
Combine cooked lentils (water included) and salt into the onion mixture. Cook on medium-low heat by adding a cup of water in small portions while stirring occasionallyf for 10 minutes.
Add serrano pepper. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve it with injera, bread or rice.

name: Spicy Minced Beef Stew
description: This dish is a favorit of mine and my family.

directions.step: Heat oil in a medium pan over a medium temperature.
Add onion to the pan and cook until tender. Then, cook the tomato with the onion for another 5 minutes.
Place the beef on the pan. While stirring occasionally, cook for about 10 minutes or until meat is cooked well done.
Add butter, mitmita, cardamom and salt to the mix and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve it while warm with injera.
